p: These three cases reveal breakthrough infection with SARS-CoV-2 despite the ongoing chronic use of hydroxychloroquine. They demonstrate variability in inflammatory and coagulation markers, as well as severity of clinical disease, despite all patients being on hydroxychloroquine and glucocorticoid therapy ( Table 1). As the incidence of COVID-19 continues to increase, ongoing studies will offer insight into effective treatments for this devastating disease. The description of COVID-19 infection occurring despite chronic hydroxychloroquine use argues against this agent being a potent antiviral agent that will be effective in the prevention or treatment of this illness. Results of the ongoing prophylactic and treatment trials with this agent are eagerly awaited.
